_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Go generic
author: contact@raphi.io
description: A golang egg that compiles a local main.go file on every start. Optimized for writable directories and caching.
startup: export GOPATH=/home/container/.go; export GOMODCACHE=/home/container/.go/pkg/mod; export GOCACHE=/home/container/.cache/go-build; mkdir -p $GOMODCACHE $GOCACHE; if [ ! -f "${GO_FILE}" ]; then echo "ERROR: ${GO_FILE} nicht gefunden!"; exit 1; fi; if [ ! -f "go.mod" ]; then echo "Initializing go.mod..."; go mod init ${EXECUTABLE}; fi; echo "Running go mod tidy..."; go mod tidy; echo "Building ${EXECUTABLE}..."; go build -o ${EXECUTABLE} ${GO_FILE}; echo "Build completed!"; exec ./${EXECUTABLE}

installation.script:
#!/bin/ash

set -e
echo "Starting installation..."

if [ ! -d /mnt/server/ ]; then
    mkdir -p /mnt/server/
fi

cd /mnt/server/

if [ ! -f "main.go" ]; then
    echo "Creating example main.go file..."
    cat > main.go << 'EOF'
package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "os"
    "os/signal"
    "syscall"
)

func main() {
    sigChan := make(chan os.Signal, 1)
    signal.Notify(sigChan, syscall.SIGINT, syscall.SIGTERM)

    fmt.Println("Server started successfully")
    fmt.Println("Replace this main.go with your own code!")
    
    sig := <-sigChan
    fmt.Printf("Received signal: %v. Shutting down...\n", sig)
    os.Exit(0)
}
EOF
fi

echo "Installation completed!"
exit 0

variables.name: Go File
variables.description: The main Go file to compile (typically main.go)

variables.name: Executable
variables.description: Name of the compiled executable (also used as module name)
